intro: Xysmalobium coronarium, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its distinctive, thorny stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody, branched structure and small, leathery leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry climates. Xysmalobium coronarium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
